data.title: A Very Happy Anniversary Dinner
data.text: My wife's parents have been married over 60 years; and, we decided it would be great to take them out to a nice dinner to celebrate. So, we picked the Bistro because we had eaten there before and had as good a meal as we had had in a long time. Needless to say, all four meals and the service were exceptional. We also enjoyed the intimacy of place: soft lighting, white table cloths, and comfortable seating. This place is special.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Had a birthday dinner for our son and grandson with my husband and Kathleen  The dinner was excellent as always

data.title: Very delicious brunches
data.text: The food is top notch and has a wonderful presentation.  The mimosas are very tasty and the atmosphere is very good.

data.title: A Very Special Small Restaurant In An Unexpected Place
data.text:
My wife and I have eaten here twice.  I live in Los Angeles--so it's a long haul to Elk Grove. I also fly model airplanes (which my wife barely tolerates), and there are occasional contests outside Elk Grove.   But she'll go to a contest if she gets a great meal out of it.  And Elk Grove has the Boulevard Bistro!  She gets dinner and is happy; I get to go to  the contest plus a great dinner so it all works out.  It's true that this is a small place. It's also true that the food is very, very good.  And people like to linger over good meals.  And that means that sometimes, as happened on our last visit, we  arrive at the appointed reservation time, and a table is not yet available.

Well Buttercup, just suck it up---or make a reservation for early in the evening.  The host does his best to make those waiting comfortable. There's a small bar with good wine, and a nice glass will make the time pass.  And then you get to eat!

But right now the rule in our house is I don't get to go to Elk Grove unless she gets to go to Boulevard Bistro.  That's fine with me.

data.title: Great food and wine!
data.text: Best dining experience in Elk Grove. Service is impeccable. Farm to table with seasonal local ingredients. Love that you don't have to drive out of EG for an exceptional meal!

data.title: Disappointing experience
data.text: I visit Elk Grove a handful of times a year. The friends that I visit there always have said great things about BB. I finally made a reservation to go there with them. What a disappointment. For starters, we ordered two plates to share, bone marrow and goat cheese. The bone marrow yielded about a tablespoon each and the goat cheese a tablespoon-sized bite for each of us. We all got the wedge lettuce salad, which was bland and nothing special, but expensive at ten dollars. I ordered the scallops with creamed corn. I should say scallop because what I literally got was one scallop and a piece of a scallop that was about one-fourth of a scallop. I cut the scallop into four pieces in order to have a five bite main course. The scallop was served on a bed of creamed corn, which was overly peppered and,again, the portion was remarkably small; the creamed corn serving could not have been more than a half of a cup, meaning another few bites. At twenty six dollars, the few bites of scallop and corn were quite expensive, to say the least. My companions ordered the rack of lamb, the seared salmon, and the pork loin. The rack of lamb consisted of three small ribs piled crisscross on the plate, which yielded about three small bites from each rib. The seared salmon consisted of about four ounces of overly-cooked and therefore dry salmon, again just a few bites. The only winner was the pork loin, which came with a rich dark brown sauce and looked like enough to feed two people. One of my companions, who has eaten there on occasion before, observed that she was very surprised at how "skimpy" the portions were, but for the pork loin. One out of four is not good. I do not plan to go back.

data.title: One of the best restaurants in the WORLD
data.text:
I have eaten in many of the best restaurants in the world, and Boulevard Bistro is right up there with the best. This little gem of a restaurant is exceptional EVERY TIME we dine there. The food is exquisitely flavoured, with the BEST ingredients shining through. The chef is clearly classically trained, and amazingly creative. As a Cordon Bleu trained person myself, I really appreciate a good demi-glace sauce, as well as enjoying the new American twists the chef comes up with. The menu is short, as should be the case when all the food is being made from scratch. 

The chef appears to care deeply about getting the best possible ingredients, picking individual tomatoes and often creating a single perfect off-menu dish from a small number of spectacularly flavored vegetables for my vegetarian husband.

Amazingly, Boulevard Bistro always seems to have a number of absolutely delicious gluten-free desserts too, for the celiacs among us. None of the store-bought boring sorbet or uninteresting fruit plate here! Given that this is a small, family-run restaurant, I suggest, if you have dietary issues, that you let them know when you book, and perhaps choose to dine at a less busy time than the middle of service, but even if you don't do that, I'll bet you have an amazing experience dining here.

This is a place at which to eat mindfully, savouring every mouthful. If you are looking for mega portions of in-your-face-flavored chain restaurant fare, this is not that. This is high quality, fascinating, beautifully-flavoured and beautifully-presented dishes in portion sizes that aren't so vast you'll be eating the leftovers for weeks. 

The restaurant is small but beautiful in terms of decor. I love the fact that everyone seems to dress beautifully to dine at Boulevard Bistro -- there are so few places in Elk Grove where dressing up doesn't look out of place! Yet despite the fact that this restaurant has such a quietly classy ambiance, there is no trace of snobbery or snootiness here. The waiting staff are utterly charming and quietly friendly and attentive -- not over-friendly or getting in the way -- just perfect. Really first rate staff.

Perfect restaurant for an anniversary dinner -- or any excuse! The chef is a genius. An absolute genius. With an amazing story too.

data.title: BB Continues To Be The Best
data.text: Semi-French based, polished, skilled and frequently experimenting. The Boulevard Bistro is the finest dining restaurant in the Elk Grove area, and a fair contestant against other like Biba's and Ella's. A family birthday evening was delightful, with service, as usual, excellent. My scallops were prepared perfectly. An excellent wine list and interesting beers offer good drinks, instead of or after a cocktail. We had an interesting chat with the chef and owner about the best way to pour beer, in which he urges to fill the center of the glass to maximize taste. Reservations are always wise, as seating is modest and clients visit regularly.

data.title: Amazing Flavors
data.text: This little bistro was a great surprise.  I was traveling through town on business and read the trip advisor reviews.  They were spot on. I started with the caprese salad which had such fresh flavors and delicious cheese. I then ordered the scallops which came on a bed of corn with braised fat back. The combination of flavors and textures was delicious.  Each dish was beautifully presented and the service was impeccable.  The chef came out to greet diners at the neighboring table. Nice to know the owner is cooking. Treat yourself to a special meal.

data.title: Diamond Hidden in Plain Sight
data.text: Don't miss this restaurant. Menu changes with the seasons and produce availability. Chef is brilliant. Reservations required but worth the trouble. Do not miss this place!

data.title: Best Restaurant in Elk Grove
data.text: Best place for a nice sit down dinner in Elk Grove. Perfect for date night or anniversary. Small with quiet ambience. Plenty of attention. Great cook.

data.title: Worst expereince
data.text: This place over charge for under quality food. And waiter service was bad too. He not only got our drinks wrong but never come check on our table.

data.title: The best of the best!
data.text: This is a small, atmospheric restaurant in a cottage style home in Old Elk Grove.  The menu is always changing and you can be sure you are getting the most for your money, both in quantity and (surely) in quality. I always love the Filet Mignon and the lamb, almost a constant on the menu, and both are a melt in your mouth experience.  The sauces that Chef Brett makes are so tasty and enhances all of his main courses. Don't forget to order dessert, most everything will please the palette.

data.title: Repeat
data.text: O' my! This was our fifth visit to Boulevard Bistro and it is worth the hour drive for us. The Salmon my wife had was very very good and my Steak was perfect. The wine list is interesting and none are in my favorite wine shop. I've been looking for a bottle of the yummy Pinot Noir we had and can't find it locally. Brett is a wonderful chef and ensures a wonderful experience. We will be back again and again.

data.title: Crabcake to die for.
data.text: What a blessing to have such a high quality, fine dining restaurant in our community.  The crab cake was an outstanding appetizer.  The poached egg on top was an unusual but delicious addition.  Our daughter enjoyed the pork cheeks.  I couldn't keep my fork out of it.  My rack of lamb beautifully prepared and plated.  Husband's filet A++.  Service never fails to be impeccable.  So many restaurants in our area loose their edge after a time.  Not this one.

data.title: A wonderful fine dining experience.
data.text: This restaurant is located in a beautifully renovated vintage home.  It is small and intimate which enhances the dining experience.  My husband and I go here for special occasions and when entertaining out of town guests.  Both the food and service is excellent.

data.title: Elegant adventure of excellent eating
data.text: Not the place I take my large portions required "man", but it is a wonderful place to meet my lady friends.  I know not all men expect a "hearty" meal, but that is the way it is for me.  It is a lovely escape with friends and the food has always been amazing.  Save room for dessert!

data.title: Out of Town Guests
data.text: Boulevard Bistro is my "go-to" restaurant for special occasions or when I have out of town guests.  The food is elegantly prepared California cuisine in the farm-to-fork manner.  The service is impeccable.  The ambiance is cozy in a lovely bungalow setting.  My favorite entree is the rack of lamb.  Desserts are seasonal, but I love the chocolate pot de creme.

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: I tried bone marrow for the first time and found it delicious. My pork cheeks entree was fabulous. Our parents had the scallops and steak and both were perfectly prepared. The wine list is underwhelming.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Been here 3 times and all have been wonderful. Service excellent also. I had the blackberry crisp for dessert and it was awesome.
